title: STOP BLAMING YOUR JUNGLER
body:
Jungler job description:
-Assist lanes
-Apply pressure to lanes
-Ward enemy jungle/keep track of enemy jungler
-Get objectives (towers/dragon/baron)

Not his/her job to win your lane for you

replies.body: It's hard to win your lane or go even when the enemy jungler is camping your lane and your jungler doesn't do anything about it.

heres the thing. if you have already lost lane badly, then the jungler helping you won't help you come back at best and at worst gives enemy laner a double kill during a countergank. If you only died once or twice, sure I'll help. But if you have died 3+ times, and one of them is solo, then what can I do?

The only exception is the duo lane. ADC/support lane must not lose too badly under any circumstance. Solo laners? You should try your hardest to be relevant.

You will never be relevant in the game if you are being camped. You lose way too much CS to make a difference. So thanks to your crap jungler, it's now basically a 5v4 game and of course your crap jungler will be complaining "Why did you let your lane opponent get so far ahead?".

> [{quoted}](name=Lugg,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bn8p8E2r,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-08-18T03:39:59.569+0000)
>
> You will never be relevant in the game if you are being camped. You lose way too much CS to make a difference. So thanks to your crap jungler, it's now basically a 5v4 game and of course your crap jungler will be complaining "Why did you let your lane opponent get so far ahead?".

meanwhile, when the jungler is camping your lane and if you are playing safe so he cant get any good ganks off, your other 2 lanes and jungler can pretty much do what they want knowing they have zero jungler presence from the enemy jungler so they can be super aggresive. its not all about you. 

Also factor in if he is camping you and not getting any kills out of it, he is effectively wasting his time and making himself weak so by your logic, its a 4v4. 

Maybe learn how to play against it instead of whining about it because its easily doable
If he's camping your lane, ward and play safe.

> [{quoted}](name=Lugg,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bn8p8E2r,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-08-18T03:18:24.076+0000)
>
> It's hard to win your lane or go even when the enemy jungler is camping your lane and your jungler doesn't do anything about it.

ward. if you get ganked, it's your own fault, not your junglers. You know why pro games dont have many deaths the majority of the time? Because they know how to play careful and where the jungler should be the majority of the time. learn how to do that and you wont die to ganks as often. but blaming your jungler is just stupid

The worst feeling is when you are clearing your first buff - "First blood" (your mid or top).
You go for a gank top or mid - "Enemy double kill" - your botlane.
You get a kill for your laner in top\mid - again "An ally has been slain" - your another laner. Then repeat 1-2 times more - you get a couple of kills\assists, 2 other lanes die.
"Report jungle, no help, gg, I'm afk".
Because I didn't even clear anything but my double buff after the first leashed camp and literally ganked all the time after.

As a jungle main, this is my life. I go gank mid, as soon as I get the kill, top is pinging. I gank bot, mid pings. I'm trying to get my first camp in 5 minutes, my team pings for dragon. I'm ganking top, the enemy jungler gives their bot lane a double kill.

if people get outclassed in a single lane, they should consider switching a role or get better.

it's those people who call "mid mid mid or top top top" and then feeds heavily while a more capable member of the team
ends up playing an assisting role (jungle, support). this is why i'm a firm believer in pick order when multiple people want the same role.
The **only** time I ever blame the jungler is when he dives the enemy tower and dies and that leads to my laner snowballing and he blames it on me.

how about when you're going even in lane, and you get massively camped but live, and you're shoved under turret. SO you back when you've taken too much harass and then you're behind so you're constantly under turret until you get dove and die and your jungler never comes once. How about then can I blame them then?

If your jungler hasn't been doing anything with the map pressure that the enemy jungler has given up elsewhere, maybe.  If they've been ganking other lanes, taking objectives, and/or farming hard on a hard scaling jungler, I'd be inclined to say "No."  If they're playing an early game ganker and haven't done anything on the rest of the map, I'd be inclined to ask them what they were doing.

I play top. I've always played assuming I will get 0 help from my jungler. If they come and assist me, fantastic. Sometimes I get camped, I try to play as safe as posbbile. yes I will fall behind if I'm camped even if I play safe as playing safe means you have to give us some cs. In this case I always just hope that becasue of the camp my team is getting an advantage elsewhere be it in other lanes, dragons or a heavily farmed Jungler. 

If there is no advantage elsewhere, I don't blame the skill of any other team mate, sometimes enemy team is just better, GG, what can I do better next game!
Nice attitude dude. Wish more people like you were in my games.

Granted, if your Master Yi jungler friend only has 3 stacks on his Devourer by 30 minutes, there might be an issue there.  Not saying it's always the jungler's fault, especially given that I play jungle, but there are times when I'm in a solo lane, keeping the enemy jungler busy, dealing with my enemy laner, farming, and still doing well... only for my jungler to donate red buff or blue buff (or both) to the enemy ADC or my lane opponent off a really badly planned gank.

There are junglers out there who suck at their role, just like there are laners out there who suck at their role.  For anyone who doesn't ward, has died 3+ times to the enemy laner (especially in solo situations) and asks me to gank, I might just tell you that I don't feel like donating more gold to your lane opponent and for you to ward and play passively.  But if I see a jungler who has more deaths than any of the laners (due to enemy laners, not enemy jungler presence), has less farm than the enemy jungle, and is building straight damage, we may have words.

Im not the type to blame or unneccesarily yell, but if I see the jungler camping me (still not blaming our jungler) and the other lanes are not getting ganks they need and we dont have any drags I'm going to be a bit worried
In my league It is always Devourer Jungles .

If the jungler lets the enemy laner push without wards like a complete jackass the entire laning phase, it is his fault his laner is down 50 CS at 20 minutes. Some people play in such a way that the only way to really deal with them is by ganking them. If you let a {{champion:82}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:126}} push forvever, your laner is going to be behind and will likely die at least once.

Oh? I didn't know there was a job description. Since when has Riot officially supported or endorsed specific jobs per lane? That's right, never. Pro players come up with metas because it's the best way for them to accomplish their goal, against players of their own skill and teamwork level. 

However, it is damn annoying when a laner is losing and blames the JG.

" -Assist lanes"
Right, you do that, you won't get blamed.

" -Apply pressure to lanes" 
Doesn't mean that every time you fail ganks you get to tax the living shit out of me nor push the wave. Oh good, you ganked, didn't even force a summoner spell, great, as if Nasus didn't already have a hard enough time farming under turret, serve him my wave (/sarcasm).

" -Ward enemy jungle/keep track of enemy jungle"
90% of the time your whole team contributes to this.

" -Get objectives"
If a laner is getting their living shit camped out of them, and you're not helping others snowball, getting a dragon, taking down turrets etc etc, then you seriously need re-evaluate your priorities.

PS. going devourer doesn't mean leaving your team 4vs5 for the rest of the game hoping your meager stacks and incapable self are enough to carry 1vs5(with 4 useless teammates on your back).
